intro: Elyna bellardii, commonly known as the Bellard's elyna, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive shape that aids in pollination by insects. Due to habitat loss, Elyna bellardii is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
